content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function, `clean_column`, first converts the input column name to lower case using the `lowercase` function. Then it strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Finally, it replaces spaces and hyphens with an underscore using the `replace` function.
